  "description": "Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores is a proudly Nigerian, multi-service retail brand committed to meeting the everyday needs of our customers through quality products, excellent service, and community-focused operations. We operate a unique combination of businesses under one roof, making us a convenient and trusted destination for families and individuals alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location:&nbsp;Gudu, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Retail / Pharmacy / Food Service

Job Description


	We seek a competent and experienced Accountant to strengthen our finance team and ensure sound financial practices across all business units.
	The Accountant will be responsible for managing day-to-day financial operations, preparing accurate financial reports, ensuring compliance with accounting standards, and supporting business decisions through data-driven analysis.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and experienced in handling complex, multi-location retail accounting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain general ledger, financial records, and internal controls across all branches
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Manage accounts payable and receivable, bank reconciliations, and cash flow monitoring
	Ensure timely remittance of statutory deductions and taxes (PAYE, VAT, WHT, etc.)
	Collaborate with auditors and regulatory bodies during audits or reviews
	Monitor branch-level revenue and expense reports
	Identify cost-saving opportunities and financial risks
	Implement accounting best practices and reporting procedures across all units
	Supervise junior accounting staff or finance officers if applicable.


Education &amp; Qualifications


	B.Sc. or HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Minimum Second Class Upper (2:1) or equivalent is a strong advantage
	ICAN/ACCA certification (or ongoing) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3&nbsp;years of post-NYSC experience in a core accounting role
	Retail industry experience is highly preferred (pharmacy, supermarket, food service, etc.)
	Experience handling multi-branch operations will be an added advantage.


Required Skills &amp; Competencies:


	Excellent knowledge of accounting principles and financial regulations
	Strong analytical and numerical skills
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Excel)
	Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
	Ability to manage multiple accounts/branches efficiently
	Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.


Other Requirements:


	Must be based in Abuja
	Must be available for full-time, on-site work
	Must demonstrate honesty, accountability, and commitment to high performance.


Remuneration


	Competitive salary commensurate with experience
	Opportunity for professional development in a growing company.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to:&nbsp;hiring436@gmail.com&nbsp;using &quot;Accountant Application&quot; as the subject of the email.",

Accountant Job at Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores




        
    

        
        Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores is a proudly Nigerian, multi-service retail brand committed to meeting the everyday needs of our customers through quality products, excellent service, and community-focused operations. We operate a unique combination of businesses under one roof, making us a convenient and trusted destination for families and individuals alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Accountant

Job Location: Gudu, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Retail / Pharmacy / Food Service

Job Description
     

            
    




	We seek a competent and experienced Accountant to strengthen our finance team and ensure sound financial practices across all business units.
	The Accountant will be responsible for managing day-to-day financial operations, preparing accurate financial reports, ensuring compliance with accounting standards, and supporting business decisions through data-driven analysis.
	The ideal candidate is proactive, detail-oriented, and experienced in handling complex, multi-location retail accounting.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain general ledger, financial records, and internal controls across all branches
	Prepare monthly, quarterly, and annual financial reports
	Manage accounts payable and receivable, bank reconciliations, and cash flow monitoring
	Ensure timely remittance of statutory deductions and taxes (PAYE, VAT, WHT, etc.)
	Collaborate with auditors and regulatory bodies during audits or reviews
	Monitor branch-level revenue and expense reports
	Identify cost-saving opportunities and financial risks
	Implement accounting best practices and reporting procedures across all units
	Supervise junior accounting staff or finance officers if applicable.


Education & Qualifications


	B.Sc. or HND in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	Minimum Second Class Upper (2:1) or equivalent is a strong advantage
	ICAN/ACCA certification (or ongoing) is an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 years of post-NYSC experience in a core accounting role
	Retail industry experience is highly preferred (pharmacy, supermarket, food service, etc.)
	Experience handling multi-branch operations will be an added advantage.


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Excellent knowledge of accounting principles and financial regulations
	Strong analytical and numerical skills
	Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, Excel)
	Attention to detail and high level of accuracy
	Ability to manage multiple accounts/branches efficiently
	Strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills.


Other Requirements:


	Must be based in Abuja
	Must be available for full-time, on-site work
	Must demonstrate honesty, accountability, and commitment to high performance.


Remuneration


	Competitive salary commensurate with experience
	Opportunity for professional development in a growing company.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CVs to: hiring436@gmail.com using "Accountant Application" as the subject of the email.

Customer Service Representative (Igbo & English) Job at Seven-Up Bottling Company Limited




        
    

        
        Seven-Up Bottling Company Ltd is one of the largest manufacturing companies in Nigeria, producing and distributing some of the nation’s most- loved beverages in the country like; Pepsi, 7Up, Mirinda, Teem, Mountain Dew, H2oH!, Lipton Ice Tea and Aquafina premium drinking water. SBC has recently entered into Home & Personal Care category with the 2SURE brand and launched its first product, a Hand & Surface Sanitizer. Seven Up boasts of nine bottling plants with state-of-the-art manufacturing facilities strategically located across various regions in the country.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Representative (Igbo & English)
Job Location: Ijora, Lagos
Job Type: Full Time

Job Summary


	Customer Service Representative is the front line of support for the company's customers.
	You'll be responsible for answering customer questions, resolving customer problems, and providing excellent customer service.


Responsibilities


	Answer customer questions about products or services
	Resolve customer problems and complaints in a timely manner
	Provide customer support via various channels
	Escalate complex customer issues to management
	Collect and record customer feedback
	Help to improve the customer experience.


Qualifications


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration or relevant field.
	A minimum of 2 years of proven experience in a customer service position in a manufacturing industry or relevant industry
	Must be proficient in Igbo language and fluent in English
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office and customer service software.
	Must be open to working on a shift schedule
	Outstanding written and verbal communication skills.
	Good understanding of management practices and techniques.
	Excellent leadership and interpersonal skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: careers@sevenup.org using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

Job Position: Quality Assurance Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Kaduna
Employment Type: Full-time
Sector: FMCG

	We are currently recruiting a Quality Assurance Manager who will be accountable for ensuring that the plant follows and adheres to quality protocols and produces the highest quality product.
	He/She will be responsible for communicating quality procedures and developing long term sustainable practices to maintain superior quality process.


Responsibilities


	Ensure that the region adheres to standards set by PCI and regulatory policies on good manufacturing process.

	Identify and lead efforts on product/process quality and cost management opportunities to achieve productivity gains.
	Lead risk assessment analysis.
	Manage issues with non-conforming product to assure proper control, minimize loses, and provide analysis to drive the elimination of future occurrences.

Inventory Officer (Retail) Job at Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores




        
    

        
        Bakangizo Pharmacy and Stores is a proudly Nigerian, multi-service retail brand committed to meeting the everyday needs of our customers through quality products, excellent service, and community-focused operations. We operate a unique combination of businesses under one roof, making us a convenient and trusted destination for families and individuals alike.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Officer (Retail)

Job Location: Gudu, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

            
    




	We are seeking a detail-oriented and reliable Inventory Officer to manage stock levels across our pharmacy, supermarket, bakery, and restaurant operations.
	The ideal candidate will ensure accurate record-keeping, prevent stock losses, and maintain optimal inventory levels to support daily business operations.


Key Responsibilities


	Maintain accurate inventory records using software and manual logs.
	Monitor stock levels and initiate restocking where necessary.
	Coordinate with procurement, store, and department heads for stock movement.
	Investigate discrepancies and report inventory issues promptly.
	Conduct regular physical stock counts and reconcile with system records.
	Track incoming and outgoing items and ensure proper documentation.
	Implement and maintain inventory control procedures.
	Prevent stock losses through proper handling, storage, and monitoring.
	Prepare inventory reports and submit to management regularly.


Education & Qualifications


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc. in Business Administration, Supply Chain, Accounting, or related field.
	Professional certification in inventory, storekeeping, or logistics is an added advantage.


Experience:


	Minimum of 3 - 4years of experience in inventory management, stock control, or a related role.
	Experience in retail, pharmacy, or food service industry preferred.


Other Requirements:


	Must reside within or near [Gudu, Apo, Lokogoma or surrounding areas
	Must be physically fit and able to handle inventory tasks
	Must be available for immediate employment


Required Skills & Competencies:


	Strong attention to detail and accuracy
	Good analytical and numerical skills
	Proficiency in Microsoft Excel or inventory software(PHP)
	Organizational and time management skills
	Ability to work independently and within a team
	Good communication and reporting skills
	Integrity and a high level of accountability


Remuneration


	Salary: N130,000 - N150,000 / month.
	Competitive salary based on experience
